intro: Sapium cicatricosum, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, pinnately compound leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red蒴果 that split open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive. The species has medicinal uses in traditional Chinese medicine.
